title: Jedi (player monster)
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Jedi](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jedi "wikipedia:Jedi")***

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                                                                                     |

| A Jedi:* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivore "Carnivore").
* is [herbivorous](/wiki/Herbivore "Herbivore").
* is [omnivorous](/wiki/Omnivore "Omnivore").
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is a [human](/wiki/Human_\(monster_attribute\) "Human (monster attribute)").
* is normally generated [peaceful](/wiki/Peaceful "Peaceful").
* is [strong](/wiki/Strong "Strong").
* can pick up weapons and food.
* can be seen through [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                                                                                     |

A **Jedi** is a [player monster](/wiki/Player_monster "Player monster") corresponding to the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") role that appears in the [Jedi patch](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi"), incorporated by [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

Most player monsters are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and only appear on the [Astral Plane](/wiki/Astral_Plane "Astral Plane") (or, in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") and variants, the [Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers](/wiki/Guild_of_Disgruntled_Adventurers "Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers")), or if the player reads a cursed [scroll of genocide](/wiki/Scroll_of_genocide "Scroll of genocide") while [confused](/wiki/Confused "Confused"), uses [undead turning](/wiki/Undead_turning "Undead turning") on the corpse of one (found in the [Valley of the Dead](/wiki/Valley_of_the_Dead "Valley of the Dead") or a [bones level](/wiki/Bones_level "Bones level")), or casts [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") on a statue of one found on [Medusa's Island](/wiki/Medusa%27s_Island "Medusa's Island").

The Jedi role is unusual in that a number of peaceful player monsters are guaranteed to appear on several levels of the [quest](/wiki/Jedi_quest "Jedi quest"), where they will join the player in fighting the [stormtroopers](/wiki/Stormtrooper "Stormtrooper") and [Lord Sidious](/wiki/Lord_Sidious "Lord Sidious"). NPC Jedi (and, on the home level, [padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan")) will attack stormtroopers and even Lord Sidious [on sight](/wiki/Grudge "Grudge"). In return, stormtroopers and Lord Sidious will attack Jedi, when they are not attacking [you](/wiki/You "You").

If the Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers is generated, a hostile Jedi will appear, along with a hostile [padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan").

## Equipment

Jedi in the quest have equal chances of [being generated with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a red, blue, or green [lightsaber](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber").

## References

Reference: [Benjamin Schieder's Jedi Patch](http://www.benjamin-schieder.de/downloads/slashem/slashem_jedi_0.5.patch)

Jedi (player monster)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Jedi
@ Jedi (No tile)
Attacks Weapon 4d6 physical, weapon 4d6 physical
@ Jedi (No tile)
Attacks

Weapon 4d6 physical, weapon 4d6 physical

Base level 10

Speed 12
Base AC 10
Base MR 1
Alignment 3 (lawful)
Frequency (by normal means) 0 (Not randomly generated)
Genocidable No
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 400
Size medium

A Jedi:

  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is herbivorous.
  • is omnivorous.
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is a human.
  • is normally generated peaceful.
  • is strong.
  • can pick up weapons and food.
  • can be seen through infravision.

A Jedi is a player monster corresponding to the Jedi role that appears in the Jedi patch, incorporated by SlashTHEM.

Most player monsters are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and only appear on the Astral Plane (or, in SLASH'EM and variants, the Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers), or if the player reads a cursed scroll of genocide while confused, uses undead turning on the corpse of one (found in the Valley of the Dead or a bones level), or casts stone to flesh on a statue of one found on Medusa's Island.

The Jedi role is unusual in that a number of peaceful player monsters are guaranteed to appear on several levels of the quest, where they will join the player in fighting the stormtroopers and Lord Sidious. NPC Jedi (and, on the home level, padawan) will attack stormtroopers and even Lord Sidious on sight. In return, stormtroopers and Lord Sidious will attack Jedi, when they are not attacking you.

If the Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers is generated, a hostile Jedi will appear, along with a hostile padawan.

Equipment

Jedi in the quest have equal chances of being generated with a red, blue, or green lightsaber.

References

Reference: Benjamin Schieder's Jedi Patch

A '''Jedi''' is a [[player monster]] corresponding to the [[Jedi]] role that appears in the [[Jedi|Jedi patch]], incorporated by [[SlashTHEM]]. 

Most player monsters are never randomly generated (except in variants which enable random generation of player monsters) and only appear on the [[Astral Plane]] (or, in [[SLASH'EM]] and variants, the [[Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers]]), or if the player reads a cursed [[scroll of genocide]] while [[confused]], uses [[undead turning]] on the corpse of one (found in the [[Valley of the Dead]] or a [[bones level]]), or casts [[stone to flesh]] on a statue of one found on [[Medusa's Island]].

The Jedi role is unusual in that a number of peaceful player monsters are guaranteed to appear on several levels of the [[Jedi quest|quest]], where they will join the player in fighting the [[stormtrooper]]s and [[Lord Sidious]].  NPC Jedi (and, on the home level, [[padawan]]) will attack stormtroopers and even Lord Sidious [[Grudge|on sight]].  In return, stormtroopers and Lord Sidious will attack Jedi, when they are not attacking [[you]].

If the Guild of Disgruntled Adventurers is generated, a hostile Jedi will appear, along with a hostile [[padawan]].

==Equipment==
Jedi in the quest have equal chances of [[Monster starting inventory|being generated with]] a red, blue, or green [[lightsaber]].

==References==
Reference: [http://www.benjamin-schieder.de/downloads/slashem/slashem_jedi_0.5.patch Benjamin Schieder's Jedi Patch]
